articles.title: Carlos Alcaraz saves three match points to beat Sinner in epic French Open final
articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz produced one of the greatest comebacks of all time, saving match points in the fourth set, to defeat the world No 1 Jannik Sinner in five sets
articles.content: As he faced up to the excruciating reality of trailing three championship points against the best player in the world, Carlos Alcaraz started his service preparation from the Court Philippe-Chatrier baseline with a deep, long breath. For most other p... [5701 chars]

articles.title: Portugal wins Nations League after penalty shootout
articles.description: Rúben Neves has scored the winning penalty kick as Portugal defeated Spain 5-3 in a shootout to win the Nations League.
articles.content:
MUNICH (AP) — Cristiano Ronaldo hoisted up the Nations League trophy and “We Are The Champions” rang around the stadium after Portugal defeated Spain 5-3 in a penalty shootout on Sunday.
Portugal goalkeeper Diogo Costa saved Álvaro Morata’s fourth pe... [1617 chars]

articles.title: ‘Have a life besides driving’: Death of private-hire driver a wake-up call, say those in industry
articles.description: Some say drivers should not feel pushed to clock an unhealthy and unsustainable amount of time on the roads.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE: The death of 49-year-old private-hire driver Gavin Neo from a stroke in May was a “wake-up call” for those in the industry looking to cash in on working long hours, some drivers say.
Friends said Mr Neo often spent up to 15 hours behind th... [2185 chars]

articles.title: Fearne Cotton: ‘I’m a million times more confident than I was in my 20s’
articles.description: Lauren Taylor chats to the presenter and podcaster about being an introvert, OCD and midlife happiness.
articles.content:
Fearne Cotton is redefining what happiness looks like in her 40s.
“It’s just maybe a level of average contentment that I’m aiming for – I don’t even know if I’m needing to land on happiness,” says the podcaster and author.
